entries.title: Biden-McCarthy Chemistry on Debt: Not Strangers But Also Not Friends
entries.description: President Joe Biden and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy followed similar, winding paths to find themselves back at a familiar point: staring out over the brink of a debt ceiling crisis.

entries.title: DeSantis Seeks Tax Cuts, State Pay Hikes in $115 Billion Budget
entries.description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis is pushing for permanent tax cuts and pay increases for state employees in the coming year’s budget as revenue surpasses forecasts.

entries.title: Former McKinsey Chief Barton Denies Trudeau Ties Helped Win Contracts From Canada
entries.description: Dominic Barton, the former head of global consulting giant McKinsey & Co., dismissed claims that his ties to Prime Minister Justin Trudeau led to his firm being favored for Canadian government contracts.

entries.title: McCarthy Sees Opportunity for Deal on Debt After Private Biden Meeting
entries.description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said he’s hopeful he can strike a deal on raising the debt limit with President Joe Biden well before the deadline when the nation would no longer be able to pay its bills.

entries.title: Powell Says Fed Can’t Shield Economy From a Debt Default
entries.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell warned against any assumption that the central bank can rescue the economy if Congress fails to raise the federal debt ceiling — a move that could force the Treasury into a payments default.

entries.title: US Opens Embassy in Solomon Islands Amid Competition With China
entries.description: The US opened a new embassy in the South Pacific as the Biden administration ramps up its diplomatic presence in a region that has been courted heavily by geopolitical rival China.

entries.title: George Santos Met Crypto Millionaires in the Hamptons and Snapped Up Campaign Cash
entries.description: The Long Island village of Southampton has long served as a getaway for New York’s ultra-wealthy, but in the summer of 2022, it welcomed a crop of newly minted magnates. George Santos, an underdog congressional candidate from the other end of the island, was there to greet them.

entries.title: Harris Condemns Killing of Tyre Nichols, Calls for Police Reform
entries.description: Vice President Kamala Harris condemned the police killing of Tyre Nichols, an unarmed Black man, and called on Congress to pass legislation overhauling law enforcement practices.

entries.title: Bolsonaro’s Son Says His Father Isn’t Fleeing Brazilian Justice
entries.description: The eldest son of former President Jair Bolsonaro said his father isn’t fleeing Brazilian justice by applying for a six-month US visa and that he would return home if called by authorities.

entries.title: Nikki Haley Wants to Convince Republicans She’s the Younger Leader They Need
entries.description: Nikki Haley aims to capitalize on the growing Republican disdain for her former boss Donald Trump and the increasing desire for a younger standard bearer as she challenges the ex-president for the party’s 2024 White House nomination.

entries.title: Amazon, Apple Spent More on Lobbying Last Year Than Ever Before
entries.description: Amazon.com Inc., Apple Inc. and Microsoft Corp. broke their lobbying spending records last year as they fended off heightened scrutiny of their business models and power over the US economy.

entries.title: Republicans Are Set to Launch Biden Probe Hours After State of the Union
entries.description: Hours after Joe Biden delivers his State of the Union Address to Congress, House Republicans will launch their promised investigation into alleged Biden family “influence peddling,” effectively nullifying any message of unity the president may deliver.

entries.title: Trump’s Attacks on Early Voting Worry Some in GOP Over Turnout
entries.description: When Donald Trump attacked early voting in New Hampshire Saturday, he was speaking to an audience who was excited to hear the message. Others aren’t so sure.

entries.title: US Ambassador Calls Russian Mercenary Actions in Ukraine ‘Unacceptable’
entries.description: US Ambassador to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield called the Wagner Group’s actions in Ukraine and on the African continent “unacceptable” and said the US would look for new ways to counter the impact of the Russian mercenaries.

entries.title: US Ambassador Says Work to Isolate Russia at the UN Continues
entries.description: US Ambassador to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield said the Biden administration and its allies are working to isolate Russia at the global body, and called for reform to the Security Council to blunt Moscow’s impact.

entries.title: NYC Bans Plastic Forks in Takeout Orders in Sustainability Push
entries.description: New Yorkers will no longer have to check the box for “no plastic utensils” on their food delivery apps. A new law that takes effect in July is going to do that for them.

entries.title: US Detains Chinese Aluminum, a Suspected Product of Forced Labor
entries.description: The US is issuing notices to buyers that it is detaining certain aluminum products coming from the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, shipping company AP Moller-Maersk A/S said on its website.

entries.title: Kamala Harris Attends Nichols Funeral as Death Reignites Reform Efforts
entries.description: Kamala Harris will lead a delegation to attend Tyre Nichols’ funeral in Memphis on Wednesday, the latest example of how the first Black and Asian-American vice president is leveraging her background to act as a conduit to a key constituency.

entries.title: Germany Plans to Spend Up to €17 Billion on Anti-Missile Shield
entries.description: Germany is in talks with several defense manufacturers to build a multi-layered, anti-missile shield that could cost as much as €17 billion ($18.5 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: McCarthy Heads to White House With Debt Ideas, But No Proposal
entries.description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said he has “a lot of ideas” he plans to share with President Joe Biden during a Wednesday meeting on how to avert a market-rattling payments default, but congressional Republicans don’t yet have a firm proposal to offer the administration.

entries.title: DOJ Searches Biden’s Beach Home as Documents Probe Accelerates
entries.description: The Justice Department searched President Joe Biden’s home in Rehoboth, Delaware, Wednesday morning, with his consent, his lawyer said, after recent discoveries of classified documents in the president’s private home and office.

entries.title: Hochul Wants a Payroll Tax Boost to Fund NYC Subways, Transit
entries.description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul wants to increase a payroll tax on businesses that benefit from the Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s network of subways, buses and commuter rail lines to help fix the transit agency’s operating deficits.

entries.title: Meta Wins Court Nod to Buy Virtual Reality Startup in Loss for Khan’s FTC
entries.description: Meta Platforms Inc. won court approval to buy virtual reality startup Within Unlimited, defeating an effort to block the deal by the US Federal Trade Commission, according to people familiar with the ruling.

entries.title: Disaster Plan Draws Skepticism in Energy-Starved South Africa
entries.description: South Africa is drawing skepticism over its plans to declare a state of disaster to help tackle crippling blackouts, with critics arguing that the measure will undermine spending controls and isn’t the solution to the nation’s energy crisis.

entries.title: Biden Special Counsel Robert Hur Takes Over Probe Into Secret Documents
entries.description: Joe Biden’s home in Rehoboth, Delaware, was being searched by the Justice Department Wednesday, the first official day of work for Special Counsel Robert Hur on the investigation into the president’s handling of classified documents.

entries.title: Sunak Must Sell N. Ireland Brexit Deal to DUP and Tories
entries.description: As UK and EU negotiators prepare to unveil a provisional post-Brexit deal for Northern Ireland, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak must walk a political tightrope to sell it to the region’s unionists and members of his own ruling Conservatives.

entries.title: Chicago Is Seeking Its Own Jamie Dimon After Griffin’s Departure
entries.description: As Chicago struggles with rising crime and high-profile corporate departures, Mayor Lori Lightfoot has a message for business leaders: It’s time to be a cheerleader for their city.

entries.title: Romania’s Next Premier Says Coalition May Endure After 2024 Vote
entries.description: The parties in Romania’s ruling coalition will swap the position of prime minister as planned by June and may try to continue ruling together after general elections expected in late 2024, according to the future Premier.

entries.title: Dutch Army to Merge Land Combat Units With Germany This Year
entries.description: The Netherlands is getting ready to integrate the rest of its combat brigades into the German Army as the two allies join military forces amid increased security threats in the region after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: Spain Plans €800 Million Credit Line to Revamp Ties With Morocco
entries.description: Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is set to announce an €800 million ($869 million) credit line for Spanish investments in Morocco, as Spain seeks to revamp diplomatic and trade ties with the North African nation.

entries.title: Myanmar Junta Extends Emergency Rule Beyond Two-Year Limit
entries.description: Myanmar’s junta has extended a state of emergency that’s been in place since it seized power in a coup two years ago by another six months, taking it beyond the constitutional limit and potentially delaying elections this year.

entries.title: Georgia Wants Russia to Leave Its Land in a Ukraine Peace Deal
entries.description: Georgia’s president said Russia must be required to abandon its nearly 15-year-long occupation of her nation’s territory as part of an eventual peace deal to end the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Tunisia Takes on Biggest Union With Arrest of Strike Leader
entries.description: Tunisia’s biggest trade union said police arrested a leader who’d called for a strike, escalating a dispute between President Kais Saied and workers over planned spending cuts needed to secure an International Monetary Fund bailout.

entries.title: Ukrainian Authorities Raid Tycoon’s Home in Crackdown on Graft
entries.description: Ukrainian authorities raided the home of businessman Igor Kolomoisky, once an ally of President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, as authorities intensify an effort to tackle corruption.

entries.title: EU Unveils a Green Investment Plan to Compete With US and China
entries.description: The European Union unveiled a roadmap for how it plans to keep its industries competitive as the bloc tries to catch up to the US and China, which offer huge subsidies to domestic green technologies.

entries.title: Wall Street: We Want Lower Rates. The Fed: Not So Fast
entries.description: Traders keep bidding up stock and bond prices in hopes that the central bank will declare victory over inflation.

entries.title: Czech Parliament Speaker to Visit Taiwan Amid Row With China
entries.description: The speaker of Czech parliament said she will visit Taiwan, a day after China lashed out at the nation’s president elect for saying he favored a stronger partnership with Taiwan.

entries.title: Adani Woes Seep Into Indian Politics for Modi
entries.description: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani likens his conglomerate’s accounting travails to an attack on the country, creating a political element as concern rises about the outlook for a business empire that owns some of India’s key infrastructure and employs thousands.

entries.title: Biden and McCarthy’s ‘First Date’ to Set Tone for Upcoming Debt Ceiling Battle
entries.description: President Joe Biden and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy will finally size each other up, after weeks of trading public barbs over spending cuts and deficits while the US debt limit hangs in the balance.

entries.title: Peru’s Inflation Spike Offers a Glimpse of Damage From Unrest
entries.description: Demonstrators block the Panamericana Norte highway during protests in Trujillo, Peru, on Dec. 14.

entries.title: White House Takes Aim at High Credit Card Late Fees, App Stores
entries.description: The Biden administration is moving to slash billions in credit card late fees and calling on Congress to open up mobile app stores to greater competition, alleging that Apple Inc. and Alphabet Inc. act as gatekeepers in ways that harm consumers and inflate prices.

entries.title: Modi’s Budget Woos Indian Middle Class, Women Ahead of 2024 Poll
entries.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi wooed hundreds of millions of middle class voters and women with incentives such as tax rebates and savings plans to ensure their backing in national elections next year.

entries.title: India’s Military Modernization in Doubt With Tiny Budget Rise
entries.description: India’s defense budget saw a modest growth of 5.5% as Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government focused instead on social sector spending and tax cuts ahead of national elections due next year.

entries.title: India Budget Top 10 Highlights: Infrastructure to Tax Perks
entries.description: In the last full year budget before Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeks a third term in May 2024, India unveiled measures for a range of audiences including taxpayers, farmers, women, senior citizens while boosting capital spending by a third for the coming fiscal year.

entries.title: Facebook Won’t Be Trump’s Salvation
entries.description: The social network has lost its dominant position as a shaper of political discourse.

entries.title: Brazil’s Senate Leadership Race Rehashes Lula-Bolsonaro Rivalry
entries.description: The race for the leadership of Brazil’s Senate has turned into a re-run of last year’s presidential vote, with both Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva and Jair Bolsonaro pushing for their candidates to capture one of the country’s most influential political positions.

entries.title: Boris Johnson Backs Calls for West to Send Fighter Planes to Ukraine
entries.description: Boris Johnson has piled pressure on western leaders to supply fighter jets to Ukraine.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Heavy Artillery Is Part of $2 Billion in US Aid
entries.description: The Biden administration will supply Ukraine with longer-range artillery and ammunition as part of a new $2 billion package of military assistance, a person familiar with the matter said Tuesday night.

entries.title: 'Adani, Adani' Heckles in Parliament Interrupt India Budget Speech
entries.description: India Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman’s budget speech was briefly interrupted by chants of “Adani, Adani” from the opposition benches, as an ongoing fight between tycoon Gautam Adani and a US short seller surfaced in parliament.

entries.title: India Aims to Trim Budget Gap to 5.9% of GDP Next Fiscal Year
entries.description: India seeks to narrow its budget deficit to below 6% of gross domestic product for the first time since the year ended March 2020, even as it plans to boost capital spending to support growth.

entries.title: Putin’s War Machine Helps Keep Russian Industry Humming
entries.description: Surging military production is helping keep Russian industry going strong, offsetting much of the damage done by international sanctions and other fallout from the invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: India Budget Proposes Boosting Capital Spending to $122 Billion
entries.description: India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed boosting spending on creation of assets by 33% in the fiscal year starting April, to support economic growth.

entries.title: Nikki Haley Plans to Challenge Trump With 2024 White House Bid
entries.description: Nikki Haley, a former South Carolina Governor and Donald Trump’s ambassador to the United Nations, plans to announce that she’s running for president.

entries.title: EU Is Poised to Miss March Goal to Agree on Reform of Debt Rules
entries.description: Christian Lindner, right, and Paolo Gentiloni in Berlin on Jan. 30.

entries.title: German EV-Chip Deal Draws Scholz as Beacon for Industry’s Future
entries.description: In the auto industry’s rocky transition to electric vehicles, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is celebrating a small but symbolic victory.

entries.title: Russian Forces Help Secure Central Africa Gold Zone in New Pact
entries.description: Three nations have agreed with the help of Russian troops to secure a gold-rich region in the Central African Republic rife with armed rebel groups, the latest sign of Moscow’s expanding influence on the continent.

entries.title: Bolsonaro Resurfaces in Orlando to Say He Won’t Leave Politics
entries.description: Brazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro has reemerged from a self-imposed exile in Florida to tell supporters he’s not done.

entries.title: China Urges Common Ground Ahead of Visit by Top US Diplomat
entries.description: China and the US must find common ground for the sake of the global economic recovery, the Communist Party’s flagship newspaper said, signaling Beijing’s continued desire to mend ties ahead of an expected visit by US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

entries.title: Australia’s Wong Warns Regional Conflict Would Be ‘Catastrophic’
entries.description: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong has warned about the risk of conflict in the Indo-Pacific as she prepares to meet her British counterpart for defense talks that will likely focus on regional issues including China’s military expansion.

entries.title: Alaska Oil Project’s Fate Unclear as Biden Cites Climate Peril
entries.description: The Biden administration telegraphed it could support a scaled-back drilling plan at ConocoPhillips’s proposed Willow project in northwest Alaska, even as it cited “substantial concerns” with the oil development and warned of further restrictions to limit its impact on wildlife and the climate.

entries.title: US, Allies Impose New Sanctions on Myanmar Two Years After Coup
entries.description: The US and its allies Canada, the UK and Australia have imposed fresh sanctions on Myanmar, adding to pressure on the military regime, two years since it overthrew the civilian government led by Aung San Suu Kyi in a coup.

entries.title: Trump Raises Under $10 Million, Ensuring GOP Race Is Wide Open
entries.description: Donald Trump raised less than $10 million after he announced his third White House campaign, a disappointing haul for the former president already facing an uphill battle in his comeback.

entries.title: Longer-Range Artillery Part of $2 Billion in US Aid for Ukraine
entries.description: The Biden administration will supply Ukraine with longer-range artillery and ammunition as part of a new $2 billion package of military assistance, a person familiar with the matter said Tuesday night.

entries.title: UK Warns of ‘Severe’ Penalties for Offshore Property Owners
entries.description: Overseas owners of property in the UK face the prospect of financial penalties or prosecution after a deadline passed for them to register with British authorities and declare the identities of their beneficial owners.

entries.title: Worst UK Strikes for a Decade Shut Schools, Cripple Rail Network
entries.description: Swathes of office staff will be forced to work from home Wednesday as widespread industrial action closes schools and cripples Britain’s rail network.
